Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.34057039]Virus:SARS-CoV-2:inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 S protein-mediated cell-cell fusion(IC50=1.36 nM);inhibition of pseudovirus infections in 293T/ACE2 cells(IC50=50.52 nM);inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=33.85 nM);SARS-CoV-2 D614G:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=103.17 nM);SARS-CoV-2 N501Y:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=128.87 nM);SARS-CoV-2 Î”H69-V70:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=111.41 nM);SARS-CoV-2 E484K:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=79.09 nM);SARS-CoV-2 B.1.1.7:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=88.49 nM);SARS-CoV-2 B.1.351:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=92.16 nM);SARS-CoV:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=73.86 nM);MERS-CoV:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=228.4 nM);HCoV-NL63:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=817.21 nM);HCoV-229E:inhibition of pseudovirus infections in Huh-7 cells(IC50=471.54 nM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: Peptides derived from HR2 sequences of viral fusion proteins, including the S protein of emerging CoVs, can competitively bind to the HR1 domain and block the formation of the viral 6-HB core, thereby inhibiting infection of the virus from which they were derived.

Literature.Title: Structure-based design and characterization of novel fusion-inhibitory lipopeptides against SARS-CoV-2 and emerging variants.
Literature.Author: Yu D, Zhu Y, Jiao T, Wu T, Xiao X, Qin B, Chong H, Lei X, Ren L, Cui S, Wang J, He Y.
